experience.title: Category Management - Fashion, Jiomart
experience.description: (Category Management, Business Development, P&L Management, Negotiation, Key Vendor Management) > Part of core team to build strategies & launch Apparels on the e-commerce platform.> Responsible for complete ownership of the category including P&L, Entitlement & Vendor Management.> Managing a portfolio of Key National Brands & Labels.> Rich portfolio of clients like ABFRL, Arvind, Raymonds, Jockey, XYXX and many more.> Vendor identification, Commercial negotiations, Onboarding & building selection.> Monitoring selection mix & bridging gap by onboarding relevant Sellers & entitlements.> Sales, inventory, demand, competition and selection analysis to help sellers make informed business decisions.> Driving seller engagement in deals & upselling FCs & sponsored products advertisement.> Addressing seller issues & getting it resolved by co-ordinating with various cross-functional teams.> Training new hires and cross functional teams.
experience.description_html: (Category Management, Business Development, P&L Management, Negotiation, Key Vendor Management) > Part of core team to build strategies & launch Apparels on the e-commerce platform.> Responsible for complete ownership of the category including P&L, Entitlement & Vendor Management.> Managing a portfolio of Key National Brands & Labels.> Rich portfolio of clients like ABFRL, Arvind, Raymonds, Jockey, XYXX and many more.> Vendor identification, Commercial negotiations, Onboarding & building selection.> Monitoring selection mix & bridging gap by onboarding relevant Sellers & entitlements.> Sales, inventory, demand, competition and selection analysis to help sellers make informed business decisions.> Driving seller engagement in deals & upselling FCs & sponsored products advertisement.> Addressing seller issues & getting it resolved by co-ordinating with various cross-functional teams.> Training new hires and cross functional teams.

positions.subtitle: Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail Ltd.
positions.description: (Category Management, Buying & Merchandising, Demand Planning, Back-end Operations)> Key role in launching & establishing the International Brand in India.		> Part of a bootstrapped team of 6 members heading various functions such as Product, Buying, Merchandising, Planning, Demand Management, Inventory Management, Brand Operations, Back End Operations, E-Com Operations(B2C marketplace & B2B) & Export Sales.		> Successfully launched 7 new EBO stores across India taking the final count to 11. 		> Designed & implemented Work processes(Backend Operations) for smooth transactions across Functions.		> Development of Apparel & Accessory products to drive both organic & inorganic growth as a Lifestyle Brand.		> Managed planning & merchandising for all the Sales Channels for the Brand (EBOs, Value Channel stores, MBOs(Trade), Export, Online Marketplace & B2B sales.		> Complete control on Inventory(Fabric, Trims & Finished Goods) & liquidation of old stocks to release Cash Flow for Business.		> Analyzing the Brand & Merchandise performance at regular intervals & quick implementation of the learnings.		> Regular interaction & reviews with CxOs for current Brand performance & new Strategies.		> Training & Development of team members & Store staffs.		> Planning, Development & Execution of Sustainability in the Brand.
positions.title: Buying & Merchandising, Simon Carter London
positions.description_html:
(Category Management, Buying & Merchandising, Demand Planning, Back-end Operations)

> Key role in launching & establishing the International Brand in India.
> Part of a bootstrapped team of 6 members heading various functions such as Product, Buying, Merchandising, Planning, Demand Management, Inventory Management, Brand Operations, Back End Operations, E-Com Operations(B2C marketplace & B2B) & Export Sales.
> Successfully launched 7 new EBO stores across India taking the final count to 11.
> Designed & implemented Work processes(Backend Operations) for smooth transactions across Functions.
> Development of Apparel & Accessory products to drive both organic & inorganic growth as a Lifestyle Brand.
> Managed planning & merchandising for all the Sales Channels for the Brand (EBOs, Value Channel stores, MBOs(Trade), Export, Online Marketplace & B2B sales.
> Complete control on Inventory(Fabric, Trims & Finished Goods) & liquidation of old stocks to release Cash Flow for Business.
> Analyzing the Brand & Merchandise performance at regular intervals & quick implementation of the learnings.
> Regular interaction & reviews with CxOs for current Brand performance & new Strategies.
> Training & Development of team members & Store staffs.
> Planning, Development & Execution of Sustainability in the Brand.

positions.subtitle: Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail Ltd.
positions.description: (Head of Louis Philippe Formals)> Key focus areas were Business development, Product strategy, Product development & People Management.		> Lead the Category management team for categories generating more than 500 crs of revenue.		> Initiated & executed various projects resulting in incremental revenue growth for both short & long term.		> Revamping of Core; Relaunch of Permapress Trousers; Establishment of Golf range of Tees; Introduction of 'Regular Fit' in trousers; Fit correction in Shirts; Optimizing Winterwear range architecture were a few Product initiatives.		> Did market research at Hyperlocal level across segments of India to launch collections catering to the localized market requirements.		> Healthy inventory in terms of Fabric & Trims as a result of better planning & old inventory utilization.		> Saved huge cost(15% to 18%) by increasing order quantity of Fabrics/Finished Goods by efficient planning following Economies of scale. 		> Active participation in revamping the Brand-Product architecture for the Brand.
positions.title: Lead- Category Manager (Formals & Winterwears), Louis Philippe
positions.description_html:
(Head of Louis Philippe Formals)

> Key focus areas were Business development, Product strategy, Product development & People Management.
> Lead the Category management team for categories generating more than 500 crs of revenue.
> Initiated & executed various projects resulting in incremental revenue growth for both short & long term.
> Revamping of Core; Relaunch of Permapress Trousers; Establishment of Golf range of Tees; Introduction of 'Regular Fit' in trousers; Fit correction in Shirts; Optimizing Winterwear range architecture were a few Product initiatives.
> Did market research at Hyperlocal level across segments of India to launch collections catering to the localized market requirements.
> Healthy inventory in terms of Fabric & Trims as a result of better planning & old inventory utilization.
> Saved huge cost(15% to 18%) by increasing order quantity of Fabrics/Finished Goods by efficient planning following Economies of scale.
> Active participation in revamping the Brand-Product architecture for the Brand.

positions.subtitle: Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail Ltd.
positions.description: (Management of the Merchandise Grid for Trousers category and ensuring the correct mix to be present at stores at all times)> Key focus areas were Business Development, Product strategy, Product development & Merchandising.		> Lead the Categories generating more than 150 crs of revenue.		> Introduction of various Product initiatives such as Premium fabric blends; Knit trousers for comfort; New product range of Perfect Trousers & Soft Formals; Stretch in 100% of the fabrics for comfort.		> Top Sell Thru(>65%) & other sales performance for Trouser Category across all Brands of Madura consistently.		> Cost reduction by optimising Fabric, Trims & Stylings(10 to 15%).		> New Product developments by visiting Mills/Vendors. 		> Changeover from Brand Fit names to Generic fit names for ease in Customer understanding.		> Developed & introduced Super Slim fit. Contribution grew from 0% to 25% & recruited new customer base.		> Liquidation of old Trims & keeping inventory under Budget. 		> Reworked on the Tags & communication on the product.
positions.title: Asst. Category Manager (Trousers & Winterwears), Louis Philippe
positions.description_html:
(Management of the Merchandise Grid for Trousers category and ensuring the correct mix to be present at stores at all times)

> Key focus areas were Business Development, Product strategy, Product development & Merchandising.
> Lead the Categories generating more than 150 crs of revenue.
> Introduction of various Product initiatives such as Premium fabric blends; Knit trousers for comfort; New product range of Perfect Trousers & Soft Formals; Stretch in 100% of the fabrics for comfort.
> Top Sell Thru(>65%) & other sales performance for Trouser Category across all Brands of Madura consistently.
> Cost reduction by optimising Fabric, Trims & Stylings(10 to 15%).
> New Product developments by visiting Mills/Vendors.
> Changeover from Brand Fit names to Generic fit names for ease in Customer understanding.
> Developed & introduced Super Slim fit. Contribution grew from 0% to 25% & recruited new customer base.
> Liquidation of old Trims & keeping inventory under Budget.
> Reworked on the Tags & communication on the product.

positions.subtitle: Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail Ltd.
positions.description: > Project on Evaluation of Consumer preferences on Styling of Allen Solly Shirts, Trousers & T-Shirts> In-depth research in Trim detailing for Basic, Basic+ & Fashion across Competitor Brands> Creation of a library of Trim styling of Shirt, T-Shirt & Trouser> Research & recommendation on Finished Goods Quality & Store issues across the MFL Stores of Gurgaun, Delhi, Kolkata, Mumbai, Chennai, Hyderabad & Bangalore> Part of Product team in Spring Summer 2015 Tradeshow for Allen Solly Sports & Allen Solly Mainline T-Shirts> Samples auditing in the Factory & Stores for Fit, Measurement & Quality> Implemented by all Brands of Madura & became an important key metric for Range planning.
positions.title: Asst. Category Manager (Apparels), Allen Solly
positions.description_html:
> Project on Evaluation of Consumer preferences on Styling of Allen Solly Shirts, Trousers & T-Shirts
> In-depth research in Trim detailing for Basic, Basic+ & Fashion across Competitor Brands
> Creation of a library of Trim styling of Shirt, T-Shirt & Trouser
> Research & recommendation on Finished Goods Quality & Store issues across the MFL Stores of Gurgaun, Delhi, Kolkata, Mumbai, Chennai, Hyderabad & Bangalore
> Part of Product team in Spring Summer 2015 Tradeshow for Allen Solly Sports & Allen Solly Mainline T-Shirts
> Samples auditing in the Factory & Stores for Fit, Measurement & Quality
> Implemented by all Brands of Madura & became an important key metric for Range planning.
